author: heinz.gassner
title: Application Portfolio Assessment
description: Catalystは何百ものプロジェクトを引き起こし、その多くがサイロモードで開発されています。これは、実質的な冗長性と戦略的整合性の欠如につながる。

f6_assessments.q0:
Since the DLT360 team has divided their proposal into 15 interlinked proposals and copied applicable parts, I take the liberty of doing the same with the assessments. The team knows how Catalyst funding works and it is understandable that they have adapted their approach into many small proposals. This, however, doesn't leave a very good impression because most of the text is copy-pasted and finding "the beef" in individual proposals is difficult. Although this feedback might sound overly critical I must stress that the team seems to be on top of their game and will create value in the Cardano ecosystem. The sums asked are modest and none of this sounds like ill-willed money grab.

The Challenge brief asks: "How can Catalyst harness professional firepower to bootstrap an accelerator environment that amplifies and commercializes funded projects?" The team wants to "establish & maintain a systematic application portfolio assessment as input to the community's professional portfolio management". If I interpret this correctly, the idea is to make the already funded projects more visible and encourage collaboration to create synergies between them. Could be worth a shot. Worth $25K? Maybe not.
f6_assessments.q1:
As the team states it, none of the proposals have a detailed plan but only an "orientational overview-listing". Hopefully in Fund8 there is more funding available and these can be combined into one proposal. Furthermore, expecting the CAs to book "on-demand MIRO sessions" with the team is not realistic. To visualize their plans, the team could have used slides, PDFs, images etc as attachments. Even an explanatory video would have been a good addition. Lastly, each proposal refers the reader to the website that is supposed to have the most up-to-date information but, unfortunately, it is largely work-in-progress. All this makes me wonder: did the team bite more than it can chew?

Yeah, again, if the team has time to do all this, they can probably do what they have planned. Rather than starting everything from scratch, however, perhaps they could collaborate with "Built on Cardano" (https://builtoncardano.com/).
f6_assessments.q2: Targeted problem: "Catalyst triggered hundreds of projects, many developing in silo-mode. This leads to substantial redundancies & lack of strategic alignment". Solution seems to be improve the already funded "Risk & Opportunity Radar" somehow. Does that address the problem? Maybe. The metrics are again based on the team's own reporting (0-100%) and a Net Promoter Score of the final presentation.

f6_assessments.q0:
It is great to have a proposal to assess catalyst project portfolio. It does have several projects divided in silos that dont talk to each other and ideascale strucuture doesnty contribuite for any overall pipeline strategy assement.
This assessment can be used to evalaute next funds and potentially suggest or supress future challenges.

I missed here, however, more details on the framkework/canvas that will be used in the "Risk & Opportunity Radar". I tried to look in the website provided but theres one picture about it and its a bit vague. It will be good to have some examples of the possible outputs and what conclusions could be drawn from it. Also, what  kind of actions, in terms of portfolio alignment/prioritization, would be recomended? What dimensions/parameters/properties of the projcts would be analyzed/considered in terms of risk and opportunities ?

Moreover, I wonder if this kind of assesment will only be done once, for the current active projects or if it will be a live thing, updated with frequency as new projcts are funded and others are concluded/discontinued. If the final outcome of this project is good but not easily replicable due to tool limitation (idea scale) it would be imporatn to consider in the future a project/portfolio management tool adequate for this real time analsys.

Last, there are a lot of vague terms in the proposal that makes it difficult to assess its potential. For instance, "Interaction with relevant projects and partners", what is relevant  for the proposer? "inter-disciplinary perspective", what disciplines are considered here? "quality checking", what is quality in this context?
There are lot of information about the "big picture" (set of 3 proosals together) but not enough of this specific project.

All in all, I see a great potential here, as this kind of portfolio assessment is much needed, and a very well sctrucutred proposal, but the core of it still lacks information or is not so easily understable.
f6_assessments.q1:
Theres a qualified committed team, though some back office resources still need to be hired. This team already lead funded proposals in F6 so I gues it is capable to run this project. There are links to verify the qualifications of all.

The plan is sensible and time-framed which is really good. Budget breakdown is well done and clear.

One point concern regarding feasibility as a whole is how the data aquisicition of these 2 steps below will be done, in terms of whether it will be directly with project leaders or with catalyst/idea scale. I wonder this because I"m not sure hot easy is to get these kind of projects data

"Interaction with relevant projects and partners
In-depth analysis of the Cardano Application Portfolio (existing and from innovation pipeline) and of the application landscape outside Cardano"
f6_assessments.q2:
There are good milestones and kpis to audit the projct. My only point here is that the kpis are a bit subjective and the scale of 0-100% proposed can lead to multiple interpretations if not set right from the begining.
I particularly liked the final deliverables and the use of NPS method to collect and measure general feedback

f6_assessments.q0: The main point of this proposal is on establishing and maintaining a systematic application portfolio assessment as input to the community's professional portfolio management. I agree with the provided problem statement, however, it would be better if some supporting argument was provided for clarifying this problem statement. The proposed solution is clearly defined, fits the challenge, as a result, the potential impact on the Cardano ecosystem as a whole in long term can be seen. Therefore, based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's impact, I would rate it with a score of 4
f6_assessments.q1: This team [DLT360] profile shows suitable skills and experiences for implementing this proposal. In another word, proof of feasibility from the team profile can be seen. The budget is clear and explained in detail. However, the risk is not defined. After all, based on the given information, I still agree with this proposal's feasibility, I would rate it with a score of 4
f6_assessments.q2: A lot of information is provided with proof for verification. As I can see, this team proposed some proposals [that is related to each other] at Catalyst Fund 7. For better understanding by the community, some connections/relationships should be clarified. After all, based on the given information, I can agree with this proposal's auditability, I would rate it with a score of 4.

solution: コミュニティの専門的なポートフォリオ管理へのインプットとして、体系的なアプリケーション・ポートフォリオ評価を確立・維持したい
experience: 30年以上にわたる業界リーダーとしての経験と、献身的なコアチーム、柔軟で分野横断的な専門家ネットワークの融合
